main event: A UFO sighting was reported near Montrilie, Ohio on 6 November 1957, involving a round object that turned from red to white, with an altitude of 1,000 feet or less, and was observed for about 2 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting involved a round object the size of a basketball that changed color from red to white.
The altitude of the object was reported to be 4,000 feet or below, with an estimated speed of 400 knots.
The sighting was a ground-radar and air-visual observation, lasting for 2 minutes.
The conclusion on the record card indicated that the sighting was likely an aircraft.
The report includes the names of the witnesses, S/SGT Hansford F. Ayes and 1st Lt. William H. Schreffler.
sighted object: round object changing from red to white
witnesses: S/SGT Hansford F. Ayes, 1st Lt. William H. Schreffler
